ETYMOLOGY: From Latin iūnior, comparative of iuvenis ('young').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Of or denoting a lower rank or standing; having less authority or experience.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （职位、地位或资历上）较低的；次级的；初级的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She was recently promoted from junior analyst to senior analyst.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她最近从初级分析师晋升为高级分析师。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person who is younger or lower in status or authority than others.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 地位、资历较低的人；初级员工。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The senior manager passed the task down to one of the juniors.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 高级经理把任务交给了其中一位初级员工。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A student in the third year of a course of study at a high school or college.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （美国教育体系中）高中或大学三年级的学生。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He is planning his master’s applications since he is a college junior now.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他现在是大学三年级学生，正在计划申请硕士课程。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adjective or noun (often used as a title suffix)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Denoting the younger of two people who share the same name, usually a son named after his father (often abbreviated Jr.).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 同名者中年纪较轻的那一位（尤指儿子随父亲同名时，常缩写为Jr.）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They named their son Michael Junior, following the family tradition.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 按照家族传统，他们给儿子取名迈克尔·朱尼尔（小迈克尔）。
